properties.description: The following arguments are supported when creating new servers:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the new server. The name has to be a valid host name or a fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

properties.name: flavor_slug
properties.description: (Required) The slug (name) of the flavor to use for the new server. Possible values can be found in our API documentation. Note: If you want to update this value after initial creation, you must set allow_stopping_for_update to true.

properties.name: image_slug
properties.description: (Required) The slug (name) of the image to use for the new server. Possible values can be found in our API documentation.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Required) A list of SSH public keys. Use the full content of your *.pub file here.

properties.name: volume_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) The size in GB of the SSD root volume of the new server. If this parameter is not specified, the value will be set to 10. Valid values are either 10 or multiples of 50.

properties.name: bulk_volume_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional, Deprecated) The size in GB of the bulk storage volume of the new server. If this parameter is not specified, no bulk storage volume will be attached to the server. Valid values are multiples of 100.

properties.name: use_public_network
properties.description: (Optional) Attach/detach the public network interface to/from the new server. Can be true (default) or false.

properties.name: use_private_network
properties.description: (Optional) Attach/detach the private network interface to/from the new server. Can be true or false (default).

properties.name: use_ipv6
properties.description: (Optional) Enable/disable IPv6 on the public network interface of the new server. Can be true (default) or false.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) User data (custom cloud-config settings) to use for the new server. Needs to be valid YAML. A default configuration will be used if this parameter is not specified or set to null. Use only if you are an advanced user with knowledge of cloud-config and cloud-init.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional) The desired state of a server. Can be running (default) or stopped.

properties.name: allow_stopping_for_update
properties.description: (Optional) If true, allows Terraform to stop the instance to update its properties. If you try to update a property that requires stopping the instance without setting this field, the update will fail.
The following arguments are supported when updating servers:

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional) The desired state of a server. Can be running (default) or stopped.
The following arguments are supported when creating server groups:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the new server group.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the server group can currently only be "anti-affinity".
The following arguments are supported when creating/changing Volumes:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the new volume.

properties.name: size_gb
properties.description: (Required) The volume size in GB. Valid values are multiples of 1 for type "ssd" and multiples of 100 for type "bulk".

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) For SSD/NVMe volumes specify "ssd" (default) or use "bulk" for our HDD cluster with NVMe caching. This is the only attribute that cannot be altered.

properties.name: server_uuids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of server UUIDs. Default to an empty list. Currently a volume can only be attached to one server UUID.
The following arguments are supported when adding Floating IPs:

properties.name: server
properties.description: (Required) Assign the Floating IP to this server (UUID).

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: (Required) 4 or 6, for an IPv4 or IPv6 address or network respectively.

properties.name: prefix_length
properties.description: (Optional) If you want to assign an entire network instead of a single IP address to your server, you must specify the prefix length. Currently, there is only support for ip_version=6 and prefix_length=56.

properties.name: reverse_ptr
properties.description: (Optional) You can specify the PTR record (reverse DNS pointer) in case of a single Floating IP address.
The following arguments are supported when updating Floating IPs:

properties.name: server
properties.description: (Required) (Re-)Assign the Floating IP to this server (UUID).
